                                                                            Hex-Dump Conversion
House Republican Leadership to Release Health Bill. Responding to pressures related to the
perception that Republicans have not been responsive to the demand for a patients' bill of rights
or tobacco legislation, the Republican House Leadership is expected to release their version of a
patients' bill of rights next week. It is expected that this bill will include a watered-down
patients' bill of rights initiative, combined with "Health-Mart" and "multi-employer welfare
association" provisions that many believe will be flawed policy. The combination of these two
provisions may well enable small businesses to exempt themselves from state -regulated health
provisions, which would have the effect of eliminating state-passed protections and lead to
further segmentation of an already flawed marketplace. The Republican initiative may include
some inefficient tax incentive initiatives, but it remains unclear how they would be paid for. As
of this writing, it is uncertain whether this bill will satisfy Congress Norwood's desire for a
patients' bill of rights initiative. If it does, the likelihood of a discharge position passing the
House will be extremely unlikely. If not, we can expect an intensive effort by both Congressman
Norwood and Congressman Dingell to collaborate on a discharge position.
